    NanoString Digital Spatial Profile study

    heatMap.Rd

    1. Exploring the normalized data by calculating the coefficient of variation (CV) for each gene (g) using the formula CVg=SDg/meang.

    2. We then identify genes with high CVs that should have large differences across the various profiled segments.

    3. This unbiased approach can reveal highly variable genes across the study.

    4. We plot the results using unsupervised hierarchical clustering, displayed as a heatmap.

    Usage

    heatMap(
  target.data,
  norm.method = "quant",
  annotation.col = c("class", "segment", "region"),
  ngenes = 200,
  scale.by.row.or.col = "row",
  show.rownames = FALSE,
  show.colnames = FALSE,
  clustering.method = "average",
  cluster.rows = TRUE,
  cluster.cols = TRUE,
  clustering.distance.rows = "correlation",
  clustering.distance.cols = "correlation",
  annotation.row = NA,
  image.width = 3600,
  image.height = 1800,
  image.resolution = 300,
  image.filename = "heatmap.clust.highCVgenes.png",
  breaks.by.values = seq(-3, 3, 0.05),
  heatmap.color = colorRampPalette(c("blue", "white", "red"))(120)
)

    Arguments

    target.data

    Normalized targetData S4 object input file.

    norm.method

    normalization method quant: Upper quartile (Q3) normalization and neg: background normalization

    annotation.col

    the annotations shown on right side of the heatmap

    ngenes

    Number of high CV genes to cluster and plot

    scale.by.row.or.col

    scale by row or by col ("row", "column" and "none")

    show.rownames

    boolean specifying if row names are be shown.

    show.colnames

    boolean specifying if column names are be shown.

    clustering.method

    clustering method used. Accepts the same values as hclust. e.g "ward.D", "ward.D2", "single", "complete", "average"

    cluster.rows

    boolean values determining if rows should be clustered or hclust object,

    cluster.cols

    boolean values determining if cols should be clustered or hclust object,

    clustering.distance.rows

    distance for clustering by rows (correlation, or euclidean)

    clustering.distance.cols

    distance for clustering by cols (correlation, or euclidean)

    annotation.row

    the annotations shown on left side of the heatmap

    image.width

    image width

    image.height

    image height

    image.resolution

    image resolution

    image.filename

    image filename

    breaks.by.values

    a sequence of numbers that covers the range of values in mat e.g seq(-3, 3, 0.05), 6/0.05=120 colors.

    heatmap.color

    colors of heatmap colorRampPalette(c("blue", "white", "red"))(120), here 120 is consistent with 120 above.

    Value

    A list containing the plot genes data matrix, and the heatmap plot.
